item.title: The Dangers of Public WiFi- A Cyber Security Specialist's Perspective
item.description: Introduction Public WiFi is everywhere. Whether you’re at a coffee shop, airport, or hotel, it’s tempting to connect to free WiFi networks to save on data usage. However, as a cyber security specialist, I strongly advise against using public WiFi. In this blog post, I will explain why public WiFi is so dangerous and offer tips for staying safe online. Unencrypted Connections Public WiFi networks are often unencrypted, which means that anyone can intercept the data that you send and receive over the network.

item.title: What is Open Source Software and Why Should You Care?
item.description: Introduction Open source software is a type of software that is freely available to anyone to use, modify, and distribute. In this blog post, we will explain what open source software is and why it’s important. Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing Open source software encourages collaboration among developers and promotes knowledge-sharing. By making the source code of the software accessible to everyone, developers can benefit from each other’s expertise and insights.
